attributes.action: Ban inappropriate "All About Me" self-touching lessons for six year olds
attributes.additional_details: Things are already out of control with our  teenagers, now we hear that children of six and seven are to become prey to yet more out-of-control "programme makers", who conveniently do not come under the close scrutinies /vetting procedures of our teachers. Schools are not buildings full of products for social engineers to play with. We can only speculate as to the motivation of programme initiators. https://agentsmithreports.blogspot.com/2019/09/self-touching-classes-for-six-year-olds.html
attributes.background: I'd very much like parliament to hear the concerns of worried parents across UK who've recently been told that the already inappropriate  "All About me" programme is to roll out "self-touching" lessons to children six years old and upwards - the pertinent words in that sentence being "children".

rejection.details:
In any case, we can't accept your petition because the All About Me programme isn't a national UK Government scheme. It's a decision for individual local schools whether they wish to adopt the programme, not the UK Government or Parliament as a whole.

You can find out more about what the Government is proposing around Relationships and Sex Education here:

https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/social-policy/education/relationships-and-sex-education-in-schools-whats-changing/

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do.
